# Document

{/* Define attributes and code as variables */}
{(() => {
  const attributes = [
    {
      name: "response",
      type: "string (base64)",
      description: "The response body is a base64-encoded string containing the document content. Decode this string using standard base64 decoding to obtain the binary document file. When available, a header named 'Original-Content-Type' will be included in the response, indicating the MIME type of the document (e.g., 'application/pdf'). The base64 string can be used directly in data URIs for web applications or decoded to save as a file.",
    },
  ];

  // Request attributes for GET /api/v2/documents/:id/:document_type
  const requestAttributes = [
    {
      name: "id",
      type: "integer",
      description: "The unique identifier of the document.",
      required: true,
    },
    {
      name: "document_type",
      type: "string",
      description: "The type of document. Common values include 'lease_document', 'aan_document', 'user_uploaded_document'.",
      required: true,
    },
  ];

  // GET request doesn't have a body
  const requestExampleCode = '';

  const exampleCode = ``;

  return (
    <ApiPage
      title="Document"
      description="The Document object represents a lease or lease transaction document and is included in the serialized data for each lease or lease transaction. It features a url field that provides access to the document's base64-encoded content. This URL is pre-generated for you, so you won't need to construct it yourself. To access the content, simply provide your API key, as with other endpoints. When available, a header named 'Original-Content-Type' will be included in the response. This header indicates the MIME type of the document. For example, you might see 'Original-Content-Type: application/pdf'."
      method="GET"
      path="/api/v2/documents/:id/:document_type"
      attributes={attributes}
      exampleCode={exampleCode}
      exampleTitle="Example response (base64-encoded document string)"
      exampleLang="text"
      contentType="application/pdf"
      formatLabel="TEXT"
      requestAttributes={requestAttributes}
      requestExampleCode={requestExampleCode}
      requestExampleTitle="Example request"
      requestMethod="GET"
      requestPath="/api/v2/documents/:id/:document_type"
    />
  );
})()}
